intro: Coussarea austin-smithii, commonly known as the Austin-Smith's coussarea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
